body:
I think there is no good way to trace kafka 0.10, if we don't do some assumptions or set some rules. No kafka header, no way to propagation. 

If and only if kafka consumer and producer are monitored, and always under monitoring. We can do an optional plugin for low versions. Even you have that, you can't install or uninstall agent, if kafka has data. You need to wipe data in it.

See our suppoted versions doc.
So, you should understand @ascrutae PR is not for supporting 0.10, is for avoiding exception in log. 0.10 kafka is still not under tracing.

This PR look good to me. Here is the [test report](https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/blob/95f805e057ead49905f51423d8f6926139a2cf6b/2018/6/leizhiyuan/testReport-master-2018-06-03-15-20.md)
ok,thanks!
Could we close this issue? Or do you want to discuss optional kafka plugin?
@wu-sheng  let me fix it..I did not organize them before.just copy from another module.
@leizhiyuan merged. Thanks. And I think you should submit another Pr to add Sofa into supported list doc.
@wu-sheng ok, I will submit a new pr .

Yes. only use path pattern as the operation name, the backend will aggregate and analysis the metrics for the service(based on operation name).
What's the difference, if  the `operationName` use parsed path pattern~

@Anarchists  Oracle has many license restrict, I asked @ascrutae to help, but I am not sure whether could he have the suitable env.

I think debug a NPE should be easy. Could you try to solve this by your own?

I guess `parsed path pattern`, you mean the real URL? 

- Pattern: ${spring.application.name}/access/page
- URI: application-xxx/access/page

Right? If yes, try to think some one will put userid, accountid in the url, the patten looks like `/prod/order/${orderid}`. Then you can image what happens... Metrics will be useless..
Thanks, I get it.
Are you using our release versions? I have no idea. These services must be implemented by our collector.

skywalking-5.0.0-alpha

Thank you very much!
If so, I think the problem may be caused by that, you are using the wrong port for agent.

naming:
  jetty:
    host: ip
remote:
  gRPC:
    host: ip
    port: 11800
-------------------------------
If IP is changed with 'localhost', local  application can be collected.
If IP is changed with 0.0.0.0, all Agent reports this wrong.
If IP is replaced with real IP, the wrong( Cannot assign requested address)

> If IP is changed with 'localhost', local application can be collected.

Mean our release version is correct, and work well.

> If IP is changed with 0.0.0.0, all Agent reports this wrong.

Is the collector still running in local? I assume no.

> If IP is replaced with real IP, the wrong( Cannot assign requested address)

That is caused by your machine settings. Your real IPs is not real as you thought, the OS didn't allow you to bind this IP. You should deal with this through adjusting your OS settings.

Thank you very much. My server is Aliyun. The server is the VPC host of the proprietary network. If other servers want to access, it can only be configured as 0.0.0.0. But IP must be reported  as 0.0.0.0.
Issue should be in English, and please follow how to build doc.

If you want or have to use 0.0.0.0, please follow direct link doc. And can't run in cluster mode. 

I think you should use IP in VPC for collector, and agent uses direct link to connect. This is what I am using.
Issue must be in English.

You could help on document, the open source project is from community. Feel free to reorganize the doc, and ask community for suggestion. 

I am happy to accept new documents.
This is a normal issue, when you can't bind the given IPs. So we can't provide doc for the OS. ðŸ˜ŠðŸ™ƒ

Sorry, I don't know that issue must be in English.
I just tried some different configs on cloud and at local. On cloud, I use External network IP to replace the 'localhost' and '127.0.0.1' in both bin/webappService.sh and config/application.yml. But that doesn't work at all. Log shows that bad ip was used, while I checked it a few times and made sure that it's a right ip.
Then I tried it on local machine. I use inside network ip to repalce those original ip. And this time, it works.
Does the given ip should have some restrictions?

Every global open source project should be in English. Chinese is really hard for western people. Could you edit your issue and title? Change them to English too.

For IP stuff, there is no requirement from us. It is based on JVM, OS rules. Binding IP is a traditional way to build cluster. So I can't tell why, should ask for cloud service provider. I set colloector in huawei and ali cloud. They all provided IP for binding. Btw, hostname could be used too.
If agent and collector both in the same VPC, you can use the LAN address. Why you choose Internet address to bind?

> If agent and collector both in the same VPC, you can use the LAN address. Why you choose Internet address to bind?

Same question from me. You should have those IPs.

IntelliJ is so good, advise you give up eclipse.  ^_^
Is there anybody can help him for the eclipse issue?

This is a common problem, some advise for you: 
1. Retrieval issues, someone submitted same questions.
2. Read document, FAQ
3. Join our QQ group and ask to the others
Clear es data, reboot collector and agents.

@ascrutae Again, witness check is a fail safe mechanism. You can't say error caused by that. Any unsupported version has possibility to cause unexpected exception.

> agent.sample_n_per_3_secs support such a way like this : 10% ã€20%

No. But if you want, you could contribute a new optional plugin to support this sample mechanism.  Override `SamplingService` service, by learning from `/apm-sniffer/optional-plugins/trace-ignore-plugin`. This plugin overrides `TraceIgnoreExtendService` service to support new feature.

Welcome to join the community.

> does the config file : agent.config support dynamic loading

This is not an easy YES or NO question. Because some settings, such as application code, buffer size, are hard to change in runtime. So I suggest you focus on which settings do you want to dynamic reload.
@wu-sheng how did we support this in 3.x version ?
@asivanadi Open the URL I gave you already. It is the supported list.
This is only a warning. Mean Spring MVC v3 plugin will not be activated.

@asivanadi We haven't ever. At least, we don't intend to. Maybe something accidently works out.

Or given a situation like that, Collector Service and UI Service are on cloud machine (ip:58.xx.xx.xx), and Agent Service is at local machine (ip:202.xx.xx.xx). And a zookeeper machine (ip:69.xx.xx.xx).

I've saw the code,  it's just a `+` operation
Yes, would do send a pr to fix this?

@ascrutae this looks like a unsupported version. 

@eaglewa what is your spring springmvc version?

Naming, agent grpc and remote grpc should use 58.....,  ui.jetty.host should use localhost or 58

That is all.

@jcchavezs @basvanbeek @adriancole I finish the draft of transfer(not debug yet). 

The most important parts of these codes are about SegmentRef and Span's peer.
- Span's peer
https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/5f66dc9a37058c12fa98cb245d92dd3cc1f82598/apm-collector/apm-collector-thirdparty-receiver/receiver-zipkin/receiver-zipkin-provider/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/collector/receiver/zipkin/provider/transform/SegmentBuilder.java#L174-L188

- SegmentRef
https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/5f66dc9a37058c12fa98cb245d92dd3cc1f82598/apm-collector/apm-collector-thirdparty-receiver/receiver-zipkin/receiver-zipkin-provider/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/collector/receiver/zipkin/provider/transform/SegmentBuilder.java#L191-L253

Let me use an example to demo the important parts.
### FrontEnd -> BackEnd
- Span of client in FrontEnd should have a peer, which includes ip(v4/v6/hostname)+port, representing BackEnd service endpoint. In sleuth example: `localhost:9000` in `Frontend#callBackend`
- Span of server in BackEnd should have a ref, which includes:
   - application, instance, service from root span of the whole trace, FrontEnd in this case
   - application, instance, service from root span of parent segment, FrontEnd in this case too.
   - peer in Span of client. In sleuth example: `localhost:9000` in `Frontend#callBackend`

The most important, I need Zipkin team to recheck, is about how I build peer from endpoint. I find in many cases, endpoint may miss. I think I don't get the whole picture zipkin design.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/17367681/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/17367681)

Coverage decreased (-0.004%) to 24.028% when pulling **cd4c9535cf2fcb1a5503c1746dda2b659b1b37eb on update-user-cases** into **9582097d074d1837eed1f403be22c61bed095ba2 on master**.

I had found the root cause about this issue. here is my analysis:

**REASON**:
The Spring MVC framework `forward` the request when the controller method occur an exception,  It forward the request to the `${server.error.path:${error.path:/error}}` URL, When the forward happened The span that tomcat plugin generated will finish and it means the segment will finish. The Spring plugin depend on the `RuntimeContext` mechanism, the mechanism is active when the segment is unfinish, or throws exception.

**RESOLVE**:
To Modify the tomcat interceptor make it contain the forward logic.

> sometimes in a company may have hundreds of applications and they may use different agent version, if we fix some agent bug in current version, we want to know who is using this version to notify them to upgrade.

Agree first, that is the real situation you need to face. If you want to support that, we need to work on some UI pages about agent status. Do you have any drafts and intentions to implement these requirements.

Now in UI, we can have Monitor and Trace. I think you are proposing *Settings*.

If you want to do this, we can do discussion, start with the UI draft. I think the agent info should be group by application codes and instances.
FYI @peng-yongsheng @hanahmily @ascrutae
